snippet: The number of workers seeking unemployment benefits fell largely because two automakers shortened or eliminated their summer shutdowns.
abstract: Labor Department reports weekly applications for unemployment insurance fell by 26,000 in the previous week to a seasonally adjusted 350,000, lowest level since March 2008.
lead_paragraph: The number of workers seeking unemployment benefits fell largely because two automakers shortened or eliminated their summer shutdowns.

headline.seo: New Claims for Jobless Aid Fall by 26,000
headline.main: New Claims for Unemployment Benefits Fall by 26,000
headline.print_headline: New Claims for Unemployment Benefits Fall by 26,000
